V Turecku zadržali vdovu po lídrovi Islamského štátu, Erdogan tiež skritizoval USA
06 Nov 2019, 17:35 by Webnoviny
6.11.2019 (Webnoviny.sk) – V Turecku zadržali manželku zosnulého lídra extrémistickej skupiny Islamský štát (IS) Abú Bakra al-Bagdádího. V stredu to oznámil turecký prezident Recep Tayyip Erdogan bez toho, aby uviedol meno ženy alebo dátum, kedy ju zadržali. „Zadržali sme jeho ženu, ale nerobili sme okolo toho rozruch. Dnes to oznamujem po prvý raz,“ vyhlásil v Ankare turecký prezident kritizujúc Spojené štáty za vedenie „komunikačnej kampane“ o al-Bagdádího zabití. Je známe, že al-Bagdádí mal štyri ženy, píše agentúra AP.
Erdoganovo oznámenie prišlo po tom, čo turecké sily zadržali staršiu sestru niekdajšieho lídra IS Rasmíju Awád. Ženu zadržali v pondelok večer pri severosýrskom meste Azáz v prívese, kde žila s manželom, nevestou a piatimi deťmi. Šesťdesiatpäťročná Awád je podozrivá z napojenia na teroristov.
Al-Bagdádí na sebe 26. októbra odpálil samovražednú vestu po tom, ako ho v jeho skrýši pri Baríši na severe Sýrie vypátrali americkí vojaci. Niekoľko hodín po ňom zomrel pri americkom nálete v severnej Sýrii aj jeden jeho pobočník. Islamský štát si pár dní po al-Bagdádího smrti zvolil jeho následníka, známych je však o ňom len málo informácií. Rovnako nie je jasné, ako posledné udalosti narušili štruktúru skupiny.

In Turkey, the widow of the Islamic state leader was detained, while Erdogan also criticized the US
06 Nov 2019, 17:35 by Webnoviny
In Turkey, the wife of the deceased leader of the extremist group Islamic State (IS) Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi was detained in Turkey. It was announced on Wednesday by Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan without giving the name of the woman or the date she was detained. “We detained his wife, but we didn't make any fuss about it. I am announcing it for the first time today, ”said the Turkish president in Ankara criticizing the United States for conducting a“ communication campaign ”about al-Baghdad's killing. It is known that al-Baghdad had four women, AP writes.
Erdogan's announcement came after Turkish forces had arrested the older sister of former IS leader, Rasmie Awad. The woman was detained on Monday evening near the North Syrian town of Azáz in a trailer where she lived with her husband, the bride and five children. The 60-year-old Awad is suspected of being linked to terrorists.
On 26 October, Al-Baghdad detonated a suicide vest after his soldiers found him in his hiding place near Barisi in northern Syria. A few hours later, one of his aide died in an American air raid in northern Syria. The Islamic State elected his successor a few days after al-Baghdad's death, but little information is known about him. Nor is it clear how recent events have disrupted the group's structure.
